wrapScienceJ.io.stream

Class FileHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.io.stream.FileHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileHelperIJ

    public abstract class FileHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides utilities, which might be related to the framework, to locate and open files.

      FileHelper()

      static java.lang.String appendPostfixAndSetExtension(java.lang.String filePath, java.lang.String postfix, java.lang.String newExtension, boolean removeDirectory)
      Appends a postfix to the file basename and changes its extension e.g. a file path "/home/Images/myImage.tif" is changed to "/home/Images/myImage_silce16.png" with postfix = "_slice16" and extension = "png"

      Appends a postfix to the file basename and changes its extension e.g. a file path "/home/Images/myImage.tif" is changed to "/home/Images/myImage_silce16.png" with postfix = "_slice16" and extension = "png"
      static java.lang.String getBaseName(java.lang.String filePath)
      Retrieves the basename of a file by its path, by removing the directory and extention.

      Checks is the input directory path does correspond to a directory.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveResourceDirectory

        public abstract java.lang.String retrieveResourceDirectory(ResourceCore resource,
                                                           java.lang.String guessDir)
        If guessDir is neither null nor "default", and the directory guessDir exists, then guessDir is used. If guessDir is "default", then an attempt is made to obtain the image directory from metadata. If that fails or guessDir is null, an attempt is made to retrieve the last used directory in the framework. If that also fails, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        resource - A resource assumed to be opened in The Resource Processing Framework (e.g. an ImageCore in WrapImaJ)
        guessDir -
        Returns:
        a directory that might be null.

      • retrieveLastDirectory

        public abstract java.lang.String retrieveLastDirectory(java.lang.String guessDir)
        Checks is the input directory path does correspond to a directory. Attempts to retrieve the last used directory from the framework, or a default directory is that fails too.
        Parameters:
        guessDir - If guessDir is neither null nor "default", and the directory guessDir exists, then guessDir is used. If guessDir is "default", then an attempt is made to obtain the image directory from metadata. If that fails or guessDir is null, an attempt is made to retrieve the last used directory in the framework. If that also fails, null is returned.
        Returns:
        a directory that might be null.

      • appendPostfixAndSetExtension

        public static java.lang.String appendPostfixAndSetExtension(java.lang.String filePath,
                                                            java.lang.String postfix,
                                                            java.lang.String newExtension,
                                                            boolean removeDirectory)
        Appends a postfix to the file basename and changes its extension e.g. a file path "/home/Images/myImage.tif" is changed to "/home/Images/myImage_silce16.png" with postfix = "_slice16" and extension = "png"
        Parameters:
        filePath - Original path to some file.
        postfix - the postfix to append to the basename of the file
        newExtension - the new file extension for a possibly new file format.
        removeDirectory - If true, the leading directory path is removed from the resulting file name.
        Returns:
        The modified file path.

      • changeDirectoryPostfixAndExtension

        public static java.lang.String changeDirectoryPostfixAndExtension(java.lang.String filePath,
                                                                  java.lang.String newDirectory,
                                                                  java.lang.String postfix,
                                                                  java.lang.String newExtension)
        Appends a postfix to the file basename and changes its extension e.g. a file path "/home/Images/myImage.tif" is changed to "/home/Images/myImage_silce16.png" with postfix = "_slice16" and extension = "png"
        Parameters:
        filePath - Original path to some file.
        newDirectory - The new directory where to locate the new file.
        postfix - the postfix to append to the basename of the file
        newExtension - the new file extension for a possibly new file format.
        Returns:
        The modified file path.

      • getBaseName

        public static java.lang.String getBaseName(java.lang.String filePath)
        Retrieves the basename of a file by its path, by removing the directory and extention. e.g. a file path "/home/Images/myImage.tif" yields "myImage"
        Parameters:
        filePath - Original path to some file.
        Returns:
        The obtained basename.
